definition: to run in the opposite direction (idiom); to run counter to
variant of 背[bei1]
the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
to run fast/to speed/to gallop/to disseminate/to spread

sentences.english: That's antithetic al to effective prevention programs.
sentences.chinese: 这和有效的防治计划背道而驰。

sentences.english: The problem occurs where theory and reality run orthogonal to one another.
sentences.chinese: 该问题发生在理论和实际彼此背道而驰的情况下。

sentences.english: This was contrary to Matsuoka's theme.
sentences.chinese: 这是同松冈的主见背道而驰的。

sentences.english: The new Irish constitution was going against the spirit of this approach.
sentences.chinese: 新爱尔兰宪法对这一手段的精神背道而驰。

sentences.english: It is counterproductive to our efforts to resume direct negotiations between the parties.
sentences.chinese: 这与我们恢复以巴双方直接谈判的努力是背道而驰。

sentences.english: Just because you are pregnant doesn't mean you have to diverge from your vegetarian diet.
sentences.chinese: 仅仅因为你怀孕并不意味着你要与素餐背道而驰。

sentences.english: With the new retail runs counter to, and back to the previous supply and marketing cooperatives era.
sentences.chinese: 与新零售背道而驰，又回到以前的供销合作社时代。

sentences.english: Thisthinking is totally at odds with those who believe in free accessandthe democratisation of journalism.
sentences.chinese: 这与新闻免费接入，新闻业民主化完全背道而驰。

sentences.english: It is true that the products of science have been put sometimes to illiberal uses.
sentences.chinese: 科技产品的用途有时也与自由背道而驰。

sentences.english: That's antithetical to effective prevention programs.
sentences.chinese: 这和有效的防治计划背道而驰。

sentences.english: They can also run counter-rotation for installation in twins.
sentences.chinese: 他们还可以在双胞胎背道而驰安装旋转。

sentences.english: Soapy followed the man with a presentiment that luck would again run against him.
sentences.chinese: 索皮跟随着那个人，预感到幸运将再次与他背道而驰。

sentences.english: This goes against our instincts, which have made the conscious mind the arbiter mundi.
sentences.chinese: 这与我们的本能背道而驰，让意识沦成为仲裁者。

sentences.english: It's almost the opposite of what is taught in business school.
sentences.chinese: 这几乎与商学院所教授内容背道而驰。

definition: to act in a way that defeats one's purpose (idiom)
to go against/to be contrary to/to violate
as different as can be (idiom)/poles apart
to agree without prior consultation/to happen to hold the same view
contrary/opposite
to deviate/to diverge/to wander
original intention
to oppose/to set sth against/to be antagonistic to/antithetical/relative opposite/opposing/diametrical
to depart from/to deviate from/deviation
to run in parallel without hindrance/not mutually exclusive/two processes can be implemented without conflict
obstinately clinging to one's course (idiom)/willful/one's own way/dogmatic
different routes to the same destination (idiom); fig. different means of achieve the same end
to contradict oneself/self-contradictory/inconsistent
to abandon/to discard/to spurn/to forsake
to converge
inconsistent/not in agreement with/not agree or tally with/not conform to
